channel.title: Ways of mankind II
channel.description:
This series is an exploration into the origin and development of cultures, customs and folkways in various parts of the world. This second series of Ways Of Mankind is concerned with a specific subject area and with two specific cultures.,This series is an exploration into the origin and development of cultures, customs and folkways in various parts of the world. The second series of Ways Of Mankind is concerned with a specific subject area and with two specific cultures.

An online collection of early educational public radio content from the National Association of Educational Broadcasters (NAEB).

item.title: Forbidden name of Wednesday
item.description: This program, "The Forbidden Name of Wednesday," focuses on the Ashanti tribe and their concepts of law and justice.
item.dc:creator: Sinclair, Lister
item.dc:subject: Ashanti (African people)--Social conditions

item.title: World renewal
item.description: This program, "World Renewal," is the fourth in a series on the Yurok Indian culture.
item.dc:creator: Sinclair, Lister
item.dc:subject: Yurok Indians--Social life and customs

item.title: Fighting cock refrain
item.description: This program, "The Fighting Cock Refrain," is the third in a series on the Balinese culture.
item.dc:creator: Newman, Walter
item.dc:subject: Travel & Leisure

item.title: Sea-Monster and the bride
item.description: This program, "The Sea-Monster and the Bride," is the third of a series on the Yurok Indian culture and focuses on marriage customs.
item.dc:creator: Sinclair, Lister
item.dc:subject: Yurok Indians--Social life and customs

item.title: World renewal
item.description: This program, "World Renewal," is the fourth in a series on the Yurok Indian culture.

item.title: Case of the bamboo-sized pig
item.description: This program, "The Case of the Bamboo-sized Pig," focuses on the Ifugao people in the Philippines.
item.dc:creator: Sinclair, Lister
item.dc:subject: Sociology

item.title: Lion bites man
item.description: This program, "Lion Bites Man," focuses on the Ba-I-La tribe of Rhodesia (now Zimbabwe) and their concepts of law and justice.
item.dc:creator: Sinclair, Lister
item.dc:subject: Tribes--Zimbabwe

item.title: Fighting cock refrain
item.description: This program, "The Fighting Cock Refrain," is the third in a series on the Balinese culture.

item.dc:subject: Yurok Indians--Social life and customs

item.title: Case of the borrowed wife
item.description: This program, "The Case of the Borrowed Wife," focuses on law and justice in an Eskimo/Inuit community.
item.dc:creator: Sinclair, Lister
item.dc:subject: Law

item.title: The repentant horse thief
item.description: This program, "The Repentant Horse Thief," focuses on the Cheyenne people and their concepts of law and justice.
item.dc:creator: Sinclair, Lister
item.dc:subject: Sociology

item.title: Laying down the law
item.description: This program, "Laying Down the Law," summarizes this portion of the series, which focused on laws and justice in different communities of the world.
item.dc:creator: Sinclair, Lister
item.dc:subject: Statutes and codes
